question: What are the company's health insurance benefits?

classification.reasoning: The query specifically asks about health insurance benefits, which falls under human resources questions related to employee benefits.

agentResponse.answer:
The company's health insurance benefits include:

- Coverage begins on the first day of employment.
- Three plan options: Basic, Standard, and Premium.
- The company covers 80% of premiums for employees and 60% for dependents.
- Deductibles range from $500 (Premium) to $2,000 (Basic).
- Annual out-of-pocket maximums range from $3,000 to $6,000.
- Coverage includes preventive care, emergency services, hospitalization, prescription drugs, mental health and substance abuse treatment, maternity and newborn care, and pediatric services.
- The network includes 95% of providers nationwide, with out-of-network coverage available at a higher cost.

sources.text:
HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS

Our company offers comprehensive health insurance benefits to all full-time employees.

Medical Insurance:
- Coverage begins on the first day of employment
- We offer three plan options: Basic, Standard, and Premium
- The company covers 80% of premiums for employees and 60% for dependents
- Deductibles range from $500 (Premium) to $2,000 (Basic)
- Annual out-of-pocket maximums range from $3,000 to $6,000
- Coverage includes preventive care, emergency services, hospitalization, prescription drugs
- Mental health and substance abuse treatment covered
- Maternity and newborn care included
- Pediatric services covered
- Network includes 95% of providers nationwide
- Out-of-network coverage available (higher cost)

OTHER BENEFITS

Commuter Benefits:
- Pre-tax commuter benefits: Up to $300/month
- Public transportation reimbursement
- Parking reimbursement (with approval)
- Bike-to-work program: $20/month incentive
- Carpool matching service

Employee Discounts:
- Corporate discounts on products and services
- Technology discounts (Apple, Dell, etc.)
- Travel discounts
- Entertainment discounts
- Restaurant discounts
- Discount portal access

Work-Life Balance:
- Flexible work hours: Core hours 10 AM - 3 PM
- Remote work options: Available with manager approval
- Compressed workweek: Available for some positions
- Summer hours: Half-day Fridays (Memorial Day to Labor Day)
- Sabbatical program: 4 weeks after 7 years of service

Benefits Administration:
- HR Benefits Team: benefits@company.com
- Phone: Extension 1234
- Benefits portal: Available 24/7
- Annual open enrollment: November 1-15
- Benefits guide: Available online and in print

Additional Perks:
- Free snacks and beverages in office
- Catered lunches: Twice per week
- Company events: Quarterly team building
- Holiday parties and celebrations
- Employee recognition programs
- Service awards: Milestone recognition
- Referral program: $2,000 per successful hire

BENEFITS ENROLLMENT

New Employee Enrollment:
- Enrollment window: First 30 days of employment
- Benefits effective: First day of employment (health) or first of month after 30 days
- Online enrollment portal available
- HR benefits orientation session
- Benefits counselor available for questions

Qualifying Life Events:
- Marriage or divorce
- Birth or adoption of child
- Death of spouse or dependent
- Loss of other coverage
- Change in spouse's employment
- 30-day window to make changes

Retirement Planning:
- Free financial planning sessions available
- Online retirement calculator and tools
- Educational workshops quarterly
- One-on-one consultations with financial advisors
- Retirement readiness assessments

LIFE INSURANCE AND DISABILITY

Life Insurance:
- Basic life insurance: 1x annual salary (company paid)
- Additional coverage available: Up to 5x salary (employee paid)
- Spouse coverage: Up to $250,000 available
- Dependent children coverage: $10,000 per child
- Accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D): Included
- Premiums based on age and coverage amount
- Beneficiary designation required
- Coverage continues after retirement (reduced amount)

- Three plan options: Basic, Standard, and Premium.
- The company covers 80% of premiums for employees and 60% for dependents.
- Deductibles range from $500 (Premium) to $2,000 (Basic).
- Annual out-of-pocket maximums range from $3,000 to $6,000.
- Coverage includes preventive care, emergency services, hospitalization, prescription drugs, mental health and substance abuse treatment, maternity and newborn care, and pediatric services.
- The network includes 95% of providers nationwide, with out-of-network coverage available at a higher cost.

question: How do I reset my password?

classification.reasoning: The query is specifically asking about resetting a password, which falls under IT support.

agentResponse.answer:
You can reset your password using one of the following methods:

1. **Self-Service Password Reset:**
   - Go to the company portal login page.
   - Click on the "Forgot Password" link.
   - Enter your company email address.
   - Check your email for reset instructions and follow the link to create a new password.

2. **Password Reset via Phone:**
   - Call the IT Help Desk at extension 1234.
   - Provide your employee ID and manager's name.
   - Answer security questions for verification.
   - IT will send a temporary password via email, which you should change immediately.

3. **Password Reset via IT Portal:**
   - Log into the IT Support Portal (if you have access).
   - Navigate to the "Password Reset" section and follow the prompts.

Make sure to create a password that meets the company's requirements.

sources.text:
PASSWORD RESET PROCEDURES

How to Reset Your Password:

Self-Service Password Reset:
1. Go to the company portal login page
2. Click on "Forgot Password" link
3. Enter your company email address
4. Check your email for reset instructions (check spam folder if not received)
5. Click the reset link in the email (valid for 1 hour)
6. Follow the link to create a new password
7. Enter new password twice to confirm
8. Log in with new password

Password Reset via Phone:
1. Call IT Help Desk at extension 1234
2. Provide your employee ID and manager's name
3. Answer security questions for verification
4. IT will send temporary password via email
5. Log in and change password immediately
6. Temporary passwords expire after 24 hours

Password Reset via IT Portal:
1. Log into IT Support Portal (if you have access)
2. Navigate to "Password Reset" section
3. Select your account
4. Verify identity with security questions
5. Receive reset link via email
6. Follow email instructions to reset

Password Requirements:
- Minimum 12 characters
- Must include uppercase and lowercase letters
- Must include at least one number
- Must include at least one special character (!@#$%^&*)
- Cannot reuse your last 5 passwords
- Cannot contain your username or email
- Cannot contain common words or patterns
- Must be changed every 90 days
- Password complexity meter shows strength

Password Best Practices:
- Use a unique password (not used elsewhere)
- Consider using a passphrase (multiple words)
- Use password manager (company-approved)
- Never share your password with anyone
- Never write passwords down in visible locations
- Change password immediately if compromised
- Use different passwords for different systems

ACCOUNT LOCKOUT AND RECOVERY

If you're locked out of your account:
- Account locks after 5 failed login attempts
- Lockout duration: 30 minutes (auto-unlock)
- Contact IT Support at it-support@company.com
- Call the IT Help Desk at extension 1234
- Provide your employee ID and manager's name for verification
- IT can unlock account immediately after verification
- May require password reset after unlock

Account Recovery Process:
1. Contact IT Support with employee ID
2. Verify identity with security questions
3. Manager verification may be required
4. Account unlocked or password reset
5. Log in and change password
6. Review account activity for suspicious access

Suspicious Activity:
- If you notice suspicious activity, contact IT immediately
- Change password immediately
- Review account access logs
- Report to security@company.com
- IT will investigate and secure account

MULTI-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION (MFA)

MFA Setup:
- MFA is required for all company accounts
- Setup during initial account creation
- Can be set up via IT portal or with IT assistance
- Multiple methods available: Authenticator app, SMS, Email

MFA Methods:
- Authenticator App (Recommended): Microsoft Authenticator, Google Authenticator
- SMS: Text message codes to mobile phone
- Email: Codes sent to company email
- Backup codes: Provided during setup, store securely

MFA Best Practices:
- Use authenticator app for better security
- Keep backup codes in secure location
- Register multiple devices if possible
- Update phone number if changed
- Contact IT if device lost or stolen

MFA Troubleshooting:
- Not receiving codes: Check phone/email, try backup method
- Lost device: Contact IT immediately to reset MFA
- Backup codes: Use if primary method unavailable
- New device: Add via IT portal or contact IT

WIFI CONNECTION TROUBLESHOOTING

Make sure to create a password that meets the company's requirements.

question: When will I receive my refund?

classification.reasoning: The query is about the timing of a refund, which falls under finance and billing questions.

agentResponse.answer: You will receive your refund within 5-7 business days after it is approved. You will also receive an email confirmation when the refund is processed.

sources.text:
Refund Exceptions:
- Services already used are not eligible
- Custom products/services may have different policies
- Refunds after 30 days require special approval
- Setup fees are non-refundable
- Third-party integrations and add-ons subject to vendor policies
- Promotional credits and discounts are non-refundable

Refund Methods:
- Credit card: Refunded to original card (5-7 business days)
- Bank transfer: Refunded to original account (7-10 business days)
- Wire transfer: Refunded to original account (10-14 business days)
- Check: Mailed to billing address (14-21 business days)

EXPENSE REPORTS

REFUND POLICY

Refund Eligibility:
- Refunds are available within 30 days of purchase
- Subscription cancellations: refunds available within first 30 days only
- Refund processing time: 5-7 business days
- Refunds are issued to the original payment method
- Partial refunds available for unused services
- Annual plan refunds: Prorated based on months used

To request a refund:
1. Contact customer support via email or phone
2. Provide order number and reason for refund
3. Support will review your request within 2 business days
4. If approved, refund will be processed within 5-7 business days
5. You'll receive email confirmation when refund is processed
6. Refund appears on statement within 1-2 billing cycles

Reimbursement Timeline:
- Reports submitted by the 5th: paid by the 20th
- Late submissions: paid in the following cycle
- Direct deposit to your bank account
- Payment notifications sent via email
- Reimbursement appears in account within 2-3 business days of payment

PAYMENT FAILURES AND RESOLUTION

If your payment fails:
1. You'll receive an email notification immediately
2. We'll attempt to charge again after 3 days
3. Second retry attempt after 6 days
4. Final retry attempt after 9 days
5. You have a 7-day grace period to update payment
6. Account will be suspended if payment not resolved after 7 days
7. To reactivate: update payment method and account restores immediately
8. Data retention: 30 days after suspension before deletion

EXPENSE REPORTS

Expense Report Submission:
- Submit expense reports monthly by the 5th of the following month
- Use the company expense reporting system (accessible via employee portal)
- Attach all receipts (required for expenses over $25)
- Get manager approval before submission
- Late submissions may delay reimbursement
- Reports can be submitted via mobile app or web portal
- Receipts can be uploaded as photos or PDFs
- Multiple currencies supported with automatic conversion

BILLING DISPUTES AND RESOLUTION

Disputing a Charge:
1. Contact finance@company.com within 60 days
2. Provide invoice number and reason for dispute
3. Include any supporting documentation
4. Finance team will investigate within 5 business days
5. Resolution communicated via email
6. If dispute is valid, adjustment made to account

Chargeback Process:
- Contact us before initiating chargeback
- We can resolve most issues without chargeback
- Chargebacks may result in account suspension
- We'll work with you to resolve the issue
- Documentation provided to payment processor if needed

BILLING SUPPORT

agentResponse.content: You will receive your refund within 5-7 business days after it is approved. You will also receive an email confirmation when the refund is processed.
agentResponse.text: You will receive your refund within 5-7 business days after it is approved. You will also receive an email confirmation when the refund is processed.

evaluation.reasoning: The answer directly addresses the question about when the refund will be received, providing a clear timeframe of 5-7 business days after approval. It also mentions that an email confirmation will be sent, which adds to the completeness of the response. The information is accurate and aligns with the context provided regarding refund processing times.

classification.reasoning: The query specifically asks about the privacy policy, which falls under legal and compliance questions.

agentResponse.answer: The privacy policy includes information on data retention, compliance with GDPR, children's privacy, international data transfers, data processing agreements, security measures, and your rights regarding access and correction of personal data. It states that data is retained while your account is active, as required by law, and deleted when no longer needed. The policy may be updated periodically, and users will be notified of material changes. For more specific details, please refer to the full privacy policy on the company's website.

sources.text:
9. DATA RETENTION

Retention Periods:
- We retain data while your account is active
- We retain data as required by law
- We delete data when no longer needed
- Backup data may be retained longer
- See our data retention policy for details

10. CHANGES TO PRIVACY POLICY

Policy Updates:
- We may update this policy from time to time
- We will notify you of material changes
- Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance
- Check this page periodically for updates

COMPLIANCE

GDPR Compliance:
- We comply with EU General Data Protection Regulation
- Data processing agreements in place for EU customers
- Right to be forgotten implemented
- Data breach notification procedures established
- Data Protection Officer appointed (if required)
- Privacy by design and default implemented

CONTACT INFORMATION

Legal Department:
- Email: legal@company.com
- Privacy Officer: privacy@company.com
- Data Protection Officer: dpo@company.com (EU customers)

Mailing Address:
[Company Name]
[Address]
[City, State ZIP]
[Country]

For Questions:
- Terms of Service: legal@company.com
- Privacy Policy: privacy@company.com
- Data Requests: privacy@company.com
- Security Issues: security@company.com

MODIFICATIONS TO TERMS

We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will:
- Post updated terms on our website
- Update the "Last Updated" date
- Notify users of material changes via email
- Provide 30 days notice for material changes
- Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance

7. CHILDREN'S PRIVACY

Age Restrictions:
- Our services are not intended for children under 13 (or 16 in EU)
- We do not knowingly collect information from children
- If we discover we have collected information from a child, we will delete it
- Parents should contact us if they believe we have collected child information

8. INTERNATIONAL DATA TRANSFERS

Data Transfers:
- Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country
- We use appropriate safeguards for international transfers
- Standard Contractual Clauses used for EU data transfers
- We comply with applicable data protection laws

9. DATA RETENTION

Privacy by Default:
- Most privacy-friendly settings as default
- Opt-in for data sharing (not opt-out)
- Minimal data collection by default
- Privacy controls easily accessible
- Clear privacy choices for users

DATA PROCESSING AGREEMENTS

Standard Agreements:
- Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) available
- GDPR-compliant DPAs for EU customers
- CCPA-compliant agreements for California customers
- Custom agreements for Enterprise customers
- Regular updates to agreements

DPA Contents:
- Data processing purposes and scope
- Security measures and controls
- Data subject rights and assistance
- Sub-processor requirements
- Data breach notification procedures
- Data retention and deletion
- Audit rights and cooperation

REGULATORY REPORTING

4. DATA SECURITY

Security Measures:
- We use industry-standard security measures
- Data is encrypted in transit (TLS/SSL)
- Data is encrypted at rest for sensitive information
- Regular security audits and updates
- Access controls and authentication
- Employee training on data security

Security Incidents:
- We have incident response procedures
- We will notify you of breaches as required by law
- We take breaches seriously and work to prevent them
- Report security issues to security@company.com

5. YOUR RIGHTS

Access Rights:
- Access your personal data
- Receive copy of your data in machine-readable format
- Know what data we have about you

Correction Rights:
- Correct inaccurate data
- Update your information
- Complete incomplete data

question: How many vacation days do I get per year?

classification.reasoning: The query is about vacation days, which falls under human resources questions related to leave policies.

agentResponse.answer: You accrue 15 vacation days per year if you are in your first three years of employment.

sources.text:
VACATION AND LEAVE POLICIES

Vacation Days:
- Full-time employees accrue 15 vacation days per year
- Vacation days accrue at a rate of 1.25 days per month
- Maximum carryover of 5 days to the next year
- Unused days beyond carryover limit are forfeited
- Vacation requests must be submitted at least 2 weeks in advance
- Manager approval required for all vacation requests
- Blackout periods may apply (check with manager)
- Vacation can be taken in half-day increments
- Vacation accrual increases with tenure:
  - Years 1-3: 15 days
  - Years 4-6: 20 days
  - Years 7-10: 25 days
  - Years 11+: 30 days

Sick Leave:
- 10 paid sick days per year
- Unused sick days do not carry over
- Sick leave can be used for personal illness or family member care
- No doctor's note required for 3 days or less
- Doctor's note required for 4+ consecutive days
- Can be used for medical appointments
- Can be used for mental health days
- Accrues at 0.83 days per month

Personal Days:
- 3 personal days per year
- Can be used for any reason
- Do not require advance notice (within reason)
- Do not carry over to next year
- Use it or lose it policy

Short-Term Disability:
- Coverage: 60% of salary for up to 26 weeks
- Elimination period: 7 days
- Company paid for all employees
- Covers illness, injury, pregnancy
- Job protection during disability period

Long-Term Disability:
- Coverage: 60% of salary up to $10,000/month
- Elimination period: 90 days
- Company paid for all employees
- Coverage until age 65 or return to work
- Own occupation definition for first 2 years
- Cost of living adjustments available

VACATION AND LEAVE POLICIES

OTHER BENEFITS

Commuter Benefits:
- Pre-tax commuter benefits: Up to $300/month
- Public transportation reimbursement
- Parking reimbursement (with approval)
- Bike-to-work program: $20/month incentive
- Carpool matching service

Employee Discounts:
- Corporate discounts on products and services
- Technology discounts (Apple, Dell, etc.)
- Travel discounts
- Entertainment discounts
- Restaurant discounts
- Discount portal access

Work-Life Balance:
- Flexible work hours: Core hours 10 AM - 3 PM
- Remote work options: Available with manager approval
- Compressed workweek: Available for some positions
- Summer hours: Half-day Fridays (Memorial Day to Labor Day)
- Sabbatical program: 4 weeks after 7 years of service

Maternity/Paternity Leave:
- 12 weeks of paid maternity leave
- 6 weeks of paid paternity leave
- Additional unpaid leave available under FMLA (up to 12 weeks total)
- Leave can begin up to 2 weeks before due date
- Adoption leave: 6 weeks paid
- Surrogacy leave: 6 weeks paid
- Leave runs concurrently with FMLA
- Health insurance continues during leave
- Job protection guaranteed
- Return to work transition program available

Bereavement Leave:
- 3 days paid for immediate family (spouse, child, parent, sibling)
- 1 day paid for extended family (grandparent, aunt, uncle, cousin)
- Additional unpaid leave available with manager approval
- No limit on bereavement leave for immediate family

agentResponse.content: You accrue 15 vacation days per year if you are in your first three years of employment.
agentResponse.text: You accrue 15 vacation days per year if you are in your first three years of employment.

evaluation.reasoning: The answer is highly relevant as it directly addresses the question about vacation days. It provides accurate information about the accrual of vacation days for the first three years of employment. However, it could be more complete by mentioning that vacation days increase with tenure beyond the first three years, which would give a fuller picture of the vacation policy.

question: My laptop won't connect to WiFi

classification.reasoning: The query is about a technical issue related to hardware (laptop) and connectivity (WiFi), which falls under IT support.

agentResponse.answer:
Try the following steps to troubleshoot your WiFi connection issue:

1. Forget the network and reconnect.
2. Restart your device.
3. Ensure WiFi is enabled on your laptop.
4. Verify you're connecting to the correct network name (Company-WiFi).
5. Check if your device is within range of the access point.
6. Update your device's WiFi drivers.
7. If the problem persists, contact IT for further assistance.

sources.text:
WIFI CONNECTION TROUBLESHOOTING

Company WiFi Networks:
- Company-WiFi: Main network for employees (WPA2-Enterprise)
- Company-Guest: Guest network (password provided at reception)
- Company-IoT: For IoT devices (IT approval required)

Connecting to Company-WiFi:
1. Select "Company-WiFi" network
2. Enter company username and password
3. Accept certificate if prompted
4. Connected successfully

Common WiFi Issues and Solutions:

1. Cannot connect to WiFi:
   - Forget the network and reconnect
   - Restart your device
   - Check if WiFi is enabled
   - Verify you're using the correct network name (Company-WiFi)
   - Check if device is in range of access point
   - Update device WiFi drivers
   - Contact IT if problem persists

2. Slow connection:
   - Move closer to the access point
   - Disconnect and reconnect
   - Check for interference from other devices
   - Limit bandwidth-intensive applications
   - Check if too many devices connected
   - Restart router/access point (if you have access)
   - Contact IT if problem persists

3. Frequent disconnections:
   - Update your device's WiFi drivers
   - Check for software updates
   - Forget network and reconnect
   - Check power management settings (may disconnect to save power)
   - Contact IT Support for advanced troubleshooting
   - May need to update device firmware

4. Authentication errors:
   - Verify username and password are correct
   - Check if account is active
   - Clear saved credentials and re-enter
   - Contact IT if account may be locked

5. Limited connectivity:
   - Restart network adapter
   - Release and renew IP address
   - Check firewall settings
   - Contact IT for network configuration

WiFi Security:
- Always use company WiFi (not public WiFi)
- VPN required when working remotely
- Don't share WiFi password
- Report suspicious networks to IT
- Keep devices updated with latest security patches

VPN ACCESS

VPN Setup:
- VPN required for remote access
- Download VPN client from IT portal
- Install and configure with IT assistance
- Use company credentials to connect
- Available 24/7 for remote workers

VPN Connection:
1. Open VPN client
2. Enter company credentials
3. Select server location (if multiple)
4. Connect to VPN
5. Verify connection (check IP address)

VPN Troubleshooting:
- Cannot connect: Check internet connection, verify credentials
- Slow connection: Check internet speed, try different server
- Frequent disconnections: Update VPN client, check firewall
- Contact IT for VPN issues

SOFTWARE INSTALLATION AND UPDATES

To request software installation:
1. Submit a ticket through the IT portal
2. Include software name and version
3. Provide business justification
4. Wait for approval from your manager
5. IT will install within 2-3 business days
6. You'll receive notification when installed

Cannot Access Shared Drive:
- Verify network connection
- Check if VPN is connected (if remote)
- Verify access permissions
- Map network drive again
- Contact IT to verify access

Software Crashes:
- Update software to latest version
- Restart application
- Restart computer
- Clear application cache
- Reinstall software (contact IT)
- Check for known issues in knowledge base

agentResponse.content:
Try the following steps to troubleshoot your WiFi connection issue:

1. Forget the network and reconnect.
2. Restart your device.
3. Ensure WiFi is enabled on your laptop.
4. Verify you're connecting to the correct network name (Company-WiFi).
5. Check if your device is within range of the access point.
6. Update your device's WiFi drivers.
7. If the problem persists, contact IT for further assistance.

Try the following steps to troubleshoot your WiFi connection issue:

5. Check if your device is within range of the access point.

7. If the problem persists, contact IT for further assistance.

evaluation.reasoning: The answer is highly relevant as it directly addresses the issue of connecting to WiFi. It provides a complete list of troubleshooting steps that are accurate and align with the context sources provided. Each step is actionable and corresponds to common WiFi issues, ensuring the user has a comprehensive guide to resolve their problem.

question: Can you send me an invoice?

classification.reasoning: The query is specifically asking for an invoice, which falls under finance and billing questions.

agentResponse.answer: To request an invoice, please email [REDACTED_EMAIL] and include your account number or order ID. Invoices are typically sent within 24 hours.

sources.text:
INVOICE DETAILS

Invoice Information:
- Invoices sent via email automatically
- Available in account portal immediately
- PDF format for easy download
- Itemized charges included
- Tax information included based on location
- Multi-currency support for international customers
- Invoice numbers are sequential and unique
- Payment instructions included on invoice

Invoice Requests:
- Request copies via finance@company.com
- Include account number or order ID
- Typically sent within 24 hours
- Historical invoices available for 7 years

- Custom invoice formats available for Enterprise

TAX INFORMATION

BILLING AND INVOICES

Invoice Requests:
- Invoices are generated automatically for all subscriptions

- Include your account number or order ID

- Historical invoices available for download from account portal

Invoice Details:

- Payment terms: Net 30 for Enterprise, Due on receipt for others
- Late payment fee: 1.5% per month (Enterprise only)

Payment Terms:
- Standard: Payment due upon receipt
- Net 15: Available for Enterprise (small fee)
- Net 30: Available for Enterprise (standard)
- Net 60: Available for Enterprise (custom pricing)
- Prepayment discounts: 5% for annual prepayment

INVOICE DETAILS

BILLING SUPPORT

Contact Information:
- Email: finance@company.com
- Phone: 1-800-FINANCE (Mon-Fri, 9 AM - 5 PM EST)
- Live chat: Available in account portal
- Response time: Within 24 hours for email, immediate for phone/chat

Billing Portal Features:
- View all invoices and payment history
- Download invoices as PDF
- Update payment methods
- View upcoming charges
- Set up payment reminders
- Manage billing notifications
- Export billing data for accounting

question: What are the terms of service?

classification.reasoning: The query specifically asks about the terms of service, which falls under legal and compliance questions.

agentResponse.answer: The Terms of Service outline the rules and guidelines for using the services provided by the company. They include acceptance of terms, use of services, severability, entire agreement, modifications to terms, governing law and jurisdiction, and contact information. By using the services, users agree to comply with these terms and applicable laws. The company reserves the right to update these terms, and continued use after modifications indicates acceptance of the changes. For more specific details, users should refer to the full document.

sources.text:
TERMS OF SERVICE

Last Updated: January 2024

1. ACCEPTANCE OF TERMS

By accessing and using our services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and all applicable laws and regulations. If you do not agree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from using or accessing our services.

These terms apply to all users of our services, including without limitation users who are browsers, vendors, customers, merchants, and contributors of content.

We reserve the right to update, change, or replace any part of these Terms of Service by posting updates and changes to our website. It is your responsibility to check our website periodically for changes.

2. USE OF SERVICES

SEVERABILITY

If any provision of these Terms of Service is found to be unenforceable or invalid, that provision will be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary so that these Terms will otherwise remain in full force and effect and enforceable.

ENTIRE AGREEMENT

These Terms of Service, together with our Privacy Policy and any other legal notices published on our website, constitute the entire agreement between you and us concerning your use of our services and supersede all prior agreements and understandings.

Your continued use of our services after any modifications indicates your acceptance of the modified terms. If you do not agree to the modifications, you must stop using our services.

GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION

These Terms of Service and any disputes arising from them are governed by the laws of [State/Country], without regard to conflict of law principles. You agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in [State/Country] for resolution of any disputes.

For EU customers, these terms are governed by the laws of [EU Country], and disputes will be resolved in the courts of [EU Country].

SEVERABILITY

2. USE OF SERVICES

You agree to use our services only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms of Service and all applicable local, state, national, and international laws and regulations.

CONTACT INFORMATION

Legal Department:
- Email: legal@company.com
- Privacy Officer: privacy@company.com
- Data Protection Officer: dpo@company.com (EU customers)

Mailing Address:
[Company Name]
[Address]
[City, State ZIP]
[Country]

For Questions:
- Terms of Service: legal@company.com
- Privacy Policy: privacy@company.com
- Data Requests: privacy@company.com
- Security Issues: security@company.com

MODIFICATIONS TO TERMS

We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will:
- Post updated terms on our website
- Update the "Last Updated" date
- Notify users of material changes via email
- Provide 30 days notice for material changes
- Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance

The company reserves the right to update these terms, and continued use after modifications indicates acceptance of the changes. For more specific details, users should refer to the full document.

question: I need help with my expense report

classification.reasoning: The query specifically mentions 'expense report', which falls under finance and billing questions.

agentResponse.answer: Please specify what kind of help you need with your expense report. Are you looking for guidance on submission, reimbursable expenses, or something else?

sources.text:
EXPENSE REPORTS

Expense Report Submission:
- Submit expense reports monthly by the 5th of the following month
- Use the company expense reporting system (accessible via employee portal)
- Attach all receipts (required for expenses over $25)
- Get manager approval before submission
- Late submissions may delay reimbursement
- Reports can be submitted via mobile app or web portal
- Receipts can be uploaded as photos or PDFs
- Multiple currencies supported with automatic conversion

Reimbursable Expenses:
- Business travel (flights, hotels, meals, ground transportation)
- Client entertainment (meals, events, tickets)
- Office supplies and equipment
- Professional development courses and certifications
- Business-related software subscriptions
- Internet and phone expenses (for remote workers)
- Home office equipment (with manager approval)
- Conference and event registration fees
- Business meals (with client or team members)
- Parking and tolls (business-related)

Non-Reimbursable Expenses:
- Personal expenses
- Alcohol (unless client entertainment, requires approval)
- Personal travel upgrades
- Expenses without receipts (over $25)
- Traffic violations and fines
- Personal entertainment
- Gifts over $50 (requires special approval)
- Political contributions
- Personal insurance premiums

Expense Limits:
- Meals: $75 per person per day (domestic), $100 (international)
- Hotels: Reasonable rates based on location
- Flights: Economy class standard, business class requires approval
- Car rentals: Standard size, upgrades require approval
- Client entertainment: $200 per event, higher amounts require approval

Reimbursement Timeline:
- Reports submitted by the 5th: paid by the 20th
- Late submissions: paid in the following cycle
- Direct deposit to your bank account
- Payment notifications sent via email
- Reimbursement appears in account within 2-3 business days of payment

PAYMENT FAILURES AND RESOLUTION

If your payment fails:
1. You'll receive an email notification immediately
2. We'll attempt to charge again after 3 days
3. Second retry attempt after 6 days
4. Final retry attempt after 9 days
5. You have a 7-day grace period to update payment
6. Account will be suspended if payment not resolved after 7 days
7. To reactivate: update payment method and account restores immediately
8. Data retention: 30 days after suspension before deletion

Refund Exceptions:
- Services already used are not eligible
- Custom products/services may have different policies
- Refunds after 30 days require special approval
- Setup fees are non-refundable
- Third-party integrations and add-ons subject to vendor policies
- Promotional credits and discounts are non-refundable

Refund Methods:
- Credit card: Refunded to original card (5-7 business days)
- Bank transfer: Refunded to original account (7-10 business days)
- Wire transfer: Refunded to original account (10-14 business days)
- Check: Mailed to billing address (14-21 business days)

EXPENSE REPORTS

EMPLOYEE ONBOARDING PROCESS

Welcome to the company! Here's what to expect during your first week and beyond:

PRE-FIRST DAY PREPARATION

Before You Start:
- Complete pre-employment paperwork (sent via email)

question: What is the maternity leave policy?

classification.reasoning: The query specifically asks about the maternity leave policy, which falls under human resources questions related to leave policies.

agentResponse.answer: The maternity leave policy includes 12 weeks of paid maternity leave. Leave can begin up to 2 weeks before the due date. Additionally, there is the option for unpaid leave under FMLA, which can extend up to 12 weeks total. Health insurance continues during the leave, and job protection is guaranteed. There is also a return to work transition program available.

sources.text:
Maternity/Paternity Leave:
- 12 weeks of paid maternity leave
- 6 weeks of paid paternity leave
- Additional unpaid leave available under FMLA (up to 12 weeks total)
- Leave can begin up to 2 weeks before due date
- Adoption leave: 6 weeks paid
- Surrogacy leave: 6 weeks paid
- Leave runs concurrently with FMLA
- Health insurance continues during leave
- Job protection guaranteed
- Return to work transition program available

Bereavement Leave:
- 3 days paid for immediate family (spouse, child, parent, sibling)
- 1 day paid for extended family (grandparent, aunt, uncle, cousin)
- Additional unpaid leave available with manager approval
- No limit on bereavement leave for immediate family

Short-Term Disability:
- Coverage: 60% of salary for up to 26 weeks
- Elimination period: 7 days
- Company paid for all employees
- Covers illness, injury, pregnancy
- Job protection during disability period

Long-Term Disability:
- Coverage: 60% of salary up to $10,000/month
- Elimination period: 90 days
- Company paid for all employees
- Coverage until age 65 or return to work
- Own occupation definition for first 2 years
- Cost of living adjustments available

VACATION AND LEAVE POLICIES

VACATION AND LEAVE POLICIES

Vacation Days:
- Full-time employees accrue 15 vacation days per year
- Vacation days accrue at a rate of 1.25 days per month
- Maximum carryover of 5 days to the next year
- Unused days beyond carryover limit are forfeited
- Vacation requests must be submitted at least 2 weeks in advance
- Manager approval required for all vacation requests
- Blackout periods may apply (check with manager)
- Vacation can be taken in half-day increments
- Vacation accrual increases with tenure:
  - Years 1-3: 15 days
  - Years 4-6: 20 days
  - Years 7-10: 25 days
  - Years 11+: 30 days

Sick Leave:
- 10 paid sick days per year
- Unused sick days do not carry over
- Sick leave can be used for personal illness or family member care
- No doctor's note required for 3 days or less
- Doctor's note required for 4+ consecutive days
- Can be used for medical appointments
- Can be used for mental health days
- Accrues at 0.83 days per month

Personal Days:
- 3 personal days per year
- Can be used for any reason
- Do not require advance notice (within reason)
- Do not carry over to next year
- Use it or lose it policy

HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS

Our company offers comprehensive health insurance benefits to all full-time employees.

Medical Insurance:
- Coverage begins on the first day of employment
- We offer three plan options: Basic, Standard, and Premium
- The company covers 80% of premiums for employees and 60% for dependents
- Deductibles range from $500 (Premium) to $2,000 (Basic)
- Annual out-of-pocket maximums range from $3,000 to $6,000
- Coverage includes preventive care, emergency services, hospitalization, prescription drugs
- Mental health and substance abuse treatment covered
- Maternity and newborn care included
- Pediatric services covered
- Network includes 95% of providers nationwide
- Out-of-network coverage available (higher cost)

agentResponse.content: The maternity leave policy includes 12 weeks of paid maternity leave. Leave can begin up to 2 weeks before the due date. Additionally, there is the option for unpaid leave under FMLA, which can extend up to 12 weeks total. Health insurance continues during the leave, and job protection is guaranteed. There is also a return to work transition program available.

Additionally, there is the option for unpaid leave under FMLA, which can extend up to 12 weeks total. Health insurance continues during the leave, and job protection is guaranteed. There is also a return to work transition program available.

All information is accurate and aligns with the provided context.

question: I need to update my payment method

classification.reasoning: The query is specifically about updating a payment method, which falls under finance and billing questions.

agentResponse.answer:
To update your payment method, please follow these steps:

1. Log into your account.
2. Go to Billing Settings.
3. Click "Update Payment Method."
4. Enter your new payment information.
5. Verify the payment method (a small charge may be made and refunded).
6. Save changes.
7. Set it as the default payment method if you have multiple methods on file.

sources.text:
To update your payment method:
1. Log into your account
2. Go to Billing Settings
3. Click "Update Payment Method"
4. Enter new payment information
5. Verify payment method (small charge may be made and refunded)
6. Save changes
7. Set as default payment method if multiple methods on file

Payment Method Security:
- All payment information encrypted using PCI-DSS compliant systems
- Payment details never stored on our servers
- Tokenized payment processing for security
- 3D Secure authentication for additional security
- Fraud detection and monitoring systems active

BILLING CYCLE AND FREQUENCY

Payment Methods:
- Credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover)
- Debit cards (with credit card logo)
- Bank transfer (ACH) - US customers only
- Wire transfer (for amounts over $10,000 or Enterprise customers)
- Check payments (must be pre-approved, Enterprise only)
- PayPal (for small transactions)
- Apple Pay and Google Pay (mobile payments)
- Cryptocurrency (Bitcoin, Ethereum) - Enterprise only, requires approval

International Payment Methods:
- SEPA transfers (EU customers)
- SWIFT wire transfers (international)
- Local payment methods available in select countries
- Currency conversion handled automatically
- Exchange rates updated daily

Common Payment Failure Reasons:
- Insufficient funds
- Expired credit card
- Card declined by bank
- Incorrect billing address
- Card limit reached
- Bank security hold
- International transaction blocked

To resolve payment issues:
- Update payment method in account settings
- Contact finance@company.com for assistance
- Check with your bank for any holds or restrictions
- Verify billing address matches card statement
- Try alternative payment method
- Contact support for payment plan options (Enterprise only)

Payment Failure Notifications:
- Email sent immediately upon failure
- Reminder emails sent before retry attempts
- Final warning email sent before suspension
- SMS notifications available (opt-in required)
- In-app notifications for active users

Payment Methods Accepted:
- Credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, Amex, Discover)
- Debit cards
- Bank transfer (ACH) - US customers
- Wire transfer (Enterprise only, minimum $1,000)
- Purchase orders (Enterprise only, Net 30 terms)
- PayPal (for Starter and Professional plans)
- Apple Pay and Google Pay (mobile)

Payment Terms:
- Standard: Payment due upon receipt
- Net 15: Available for Enterprise (small fee)
- Net 30: Available for Enterprise (standard)
- Net 60: Available for Enterprise (custom pricing)
- Prepayment discounts: 5% for annual prepayment

INVOICE DETAILS

Reimbursement Timeline:
- Reports submitted by the 5th: paid by the 20th
- Late submissions: paid in the following cycle
- Direct deposit to your bank account
- Payment notifications sent via email
- Reimbursement appears in account within 2-3 business days of payment

PAYMENT FAILURES AND RESOLUTION

If your payment fails:
1. You'll receive an email notification immediately
2. We'll attempt to charge again after 3 days
3. Second retry attempt after 6 days
4. Final retry attempt after 9 days
5. You have a 7-day grace period to update payment
6. Account will be suspended if payment not resolved after 7 days
7. To reactivate: update payment method and account restores immediately
8. Data retention: 30 days after suspension before deletion
